meanings.definition: To saw (wood) again, especially to produce thinner pieces.
meanings.sent1: He enjoys resawing the wood to make it thinner for his project.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter is resawing the plank to create two thinner pieces.
meanings.sent3: The woodworker joked that he was resawing the board to give it a slimmer figure.
meanings.sent4: Resawing the timber felt like peeling off layers to reveal its true beauty.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic sound of resawing echoed through the workshop.

meanings.definition: The act or process of sawing wood again, especially to produce thinner pieces.
meanings.sent1: Resawing requires precision to ensure the wood is cut evenly.
meanings.sent2: The resawing of the lumber resulted in multiple thin planks.
meanings.sent3: During the resawing, sawdust filled the air like tiny snowflakes.
meanings.sent4: The resawing operation transformed the thick log into delicate slabs.
meanings.sent5: The resawing machine hummed as it sliced through the timber.
